poem:
### A Confession of Silence

In lands torn by faith and fight,  
truth wanes beneath sniper sights.  
A journalist felled, stories untold—  
her words a whisper in lands grown cold.  
Denials once draped in shadows,  
now stand bare, exposed in sorrow.  
Yet the world listens, hearts ask why,  
in a land where even truth may die.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
